items.title: Council visited wrong home to check on Sara Sharif the day before murder
items.description: A review into the run-up to her murder found "the system failed to keep her safe" and that race was a bar to reporting possible child abuse.

items.title: British Gas boss voices concerns over Scotland's energy jobs
items.description: Chris O'Shea, the boss of Centrica, which owns British Gas, says the energy transition is correct, but worries over the impact on jobs.

items.title: Ministers urge PM to sack whoever was behind anonymous briefings
items.description: Ed Miliband and Wes Streeting are urging the PM to take action over briefings to media about a challenge to his leadership.

items.title: Gaming giant Valve unveils new Steam Machine console to rival Xbox and PlayStation
items.description: The Steam Machine is a console designed to allow gamers to play PC games on their TV.

items.title: UK's first small nuclear power station to be built in north Wales
items.description: Three small modular reactors are confirmed for the site, with the potential for up to eight.
